file.content:
services:
  claude_bot:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      # - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude  # Disable for debugging
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    # user: "1001:1001"  # Disable user override for debugging
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

services:
  claude_bot:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    user: "1001:1001"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Install the application as a package
RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

[tool.poetry]
name = "claude-code-telegram"
version = "0.1.1"
description = "Telegram bot for remote Claude Code access with comprehensive configuration management"
authors = ["Richard Atkinson <richardatk01@gmail.com>"]
license = "MIT"
readme = "README.md"
homepage = "https://github.com/richardatkinson/claude-code-telegram"
repository = "https://github.com/richardatkinson/claude-code-telegram"
documentation = "https://github.com/richardatkinson/claude-code-telegram/blob/main/docs/"
keywords = ["telegram", "bot", "claude", "ai", "development", "remote", "coding"]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 3 - Alpha",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Operating System :: OS Independent",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.10",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Topic :: Communications :: Chat",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Tools",
    "Topic :: System :: Shells",
]
packages = [{include = "src"}]

[tool.poetry.dependencies]
python = "^3.10"
python-telegram-bot = "^22.1"
structlog = "^25.4.0"
pydantic = "^2.11.5"
pydantic-settings = "^2.9.1"
python-dotenv = "^1.0.0"
aiofiles = "^24.1.0"
aiosqlite = "^0.21.0"
anthropic = "^0.40.0"
claude-code-sdk = "^0.0.11"
tenacity = "^8.2.3"

[tool.poetry.scripts]
claude-telegram-bot = "src.main:run"

[build-system]
requires = ["poetry-core>=2.0.0"]
build-backend = "poetry.core.masonry.api"

[tool.poetry.group.dev.dependencies]
pytest = "^8.4.0"
pytest-asyncio = "^1.0.0"
pytest-cov = "^6.1.1"
pytest-mock = "^3.14.1"
black = "^25.1.0"
isort = "^6.0.1"
flake8 = "^7.2.0"
mypy = "^1.16.0"

[tool.black]
line-length = 88
target-version = ['py310']

[tool.isort]
profile = "black"
line_length = 88

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
testpaths = ["tests"]
python_files = "test_*.py"
addopts = "-v --cov=src --cov-report=html --cov-report=term-missing"
asyncio_mode = "auto"

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.10"
warn_return_any = true
warn_unused_configs = true
disallow_untyped_defs = true

[tool.flake8]
max-line-length = 88
extend-ignore = ["E203", "W503"]

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Install the application as a package
RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Install the application as a package
RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to home directory first for Poetry install
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ ./src/

# Install the application as a package
RUN poetry install --only-root --no-cache

# Now copy to /app and set working directory
RUN mkdir -p /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

toolUseResult.oldString:
# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot
toolUseResult.newString:
# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1000
ARG USER_GID=1000
ARG USERNAME=claudebot
toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app and set working directory
RUN mkdir -p /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

input.command: timeout 30 docker exec claude-code-bot claude auth status

content.content:
The authentication system in this Claude Code Telegram Bot is well-structured with multiple authentication methods:

## Current Authentication Implementation

**Authentication Providers:**
- **WhitelistAuthProvider**: Authenticates users based on Telegram user ID whitelist
- **TokenAuthProvider**: Uses secure token-based authentication with configurable expiration

**Key Features:**
- Session management with automatic expiration cleanup
- Multiple provider support (whitelist + token auth can run simultaneously)  
- Secure token hashing with SHA-256 + secret salt
- In-memory and extensible token storage
- Comprehensive audit logging

**Configuration:** 
Authentication is configured via environment variables in `.env`:
- `ALLOWED_USERS`: Comma-separated Telegram user IDs for whitelist auth
- `ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH`: Enable token-based authentication  
- `AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET`: Secret for token hashing

**Usage Pattern:**
The `AuthenticationManager` tries each provider until one succeeds, creating persistent sessions that automatically expire after 24 hours of inactivity.

Is there something specific about the authentication system you'd like me to help you with?

**–û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∏ —Ç–∞ —ó—Ö —Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è:**

1. **–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –∑ –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∞–º–∏ Claude CLI**: 
   - **–ü—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–∞**: –î–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ—è `~/.claude` –Ω–µ –±—É–ª–∞ –∑–º–æ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∞ –≤ Docker –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä

2. **–ù–µ–≤—ñ–¥–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å UID –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—á–∞**:

3. **–ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –∑–±–∏—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—è Docker –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É**:

   - **–†—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è**: –î–æ–¥–∞–ª–∏ –∫–æ–ø—ñ—é–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è README.md –≤ Dockerfile —Ç–∞ —Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å –≤—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è

**–ü–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å:**
- ‚úÖ Docker –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä –∑–∞–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏–≤—Å—è —É—Å–ø—ñ—à–Ω–æ
- ‚úÖ Claude CLI –º–∞—î –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ –¥–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏ —Ç–∞ –∞—É—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—é  
- ‚úÖ Bot –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º—É—î —Ç–∞ –æ–±—Ä–æ–±–ª—è—î –ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–æ–º–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è –±–µ–∑ –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–æ–∫
- ‚úÖ –í—Å—ñ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é—Ç—å —Å—Ç–∞–±—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ

Claude bot —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏–π –¥–æ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏! –í–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –π–æ–≥–æ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü—ñ–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Telegram.

–ù—ñ, —è –Ω–µ –∑—Ä–æ–±–∏–≤ commit —Ç–∞ push –∑–º—ñ–Ω. –ó–∞ —ñ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü—ñ—è–º–∏ –≤ CLAUDE.md, —è —Ä–æ–±–ª—é commit —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ –∫–æ–ª–∏ –∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—á —è–≤–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å —Ü–µ –∑—Ä–æ–±–∏—Ç–∏.

–•–æ—á–µ—Ç–µ, —â–æ–± —è –∑—Ä–æ–±–∏–≤ commit —Ç–∞ push –≤—Å—ñ—Ö –≤–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—å –Ω–∞ GitHub? –ó–º—ñ–Ω–∏ –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—é—Ç—å:

1. **docker-compose.yml**: –†–æ–∑–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è –º–æ–Ω—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è `~/.claude` —Ç–∞ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∞ user –Ω–∞ `"1000:1000"`

–¶—ñ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏ –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ—ó —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏ Claude bot –Ω–∞ —ñ–Ω—à–∏—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞—Ö –∑ —Ç–∏–º –∂–µ setup.

diff --git a/Dockerfile b/Dockerfile
index 56c2d55..e5f07a3 100644
--- a/Dockerfile
+++ b/Dockerfile
@@ -5,8 +5,8 @@
 FROM python:3.11-slim
 
 # Build arguments for flexibility
-ARG USER_UID=1001
-ARG USER_GID=1001
+ARG USER_UID=1000
+ARG USER_GID=1000
 ARG USERNAME=claudebot
 
 # Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
 ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"
 
 # Copy dependency files for Poetry
-COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./
+COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./
 
 # Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
 RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
@@ -63,16 +63,14 @@ RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
     && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
     && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude
 
-# Copy application code to /app
+# Copy application code to /app and set working directory
+RUN mkdir -p /app
 COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
 COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/
 
 # Set working directory to /app
 WORKDIR /app
 
-# Install the application as a package
-RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache
-
 # Health check with comprehensive validation
 HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
     CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

diff --git a/Dockerfile b/Dockerfile
index 56c2d55..e5f07a3 100644
--- a/Dockerfile
+++ b/Dockerfile
@@ -5,8 +5,8 @@
 FROM python:3.11-slim
 
 # Build arguments for flexibility
-ARG USER_UID=1001
-ARG USER_GID=1001
+ARG USER_UID=1000
+ARG USER_GID=1000
 ARG USERNAME=claudebot
 
 # Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
 ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"
 
 # Copy dependency files for Poetry
-COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./
+COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./
 
 # Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
 RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
@@ -63,16 +63,14 @@ RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
     && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
     && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude
 
-# Copy application code to /app
+# Copy application code to /app and set working directory
+RUN mkdir -p /app
 COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
 COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/
 
 # Set working directory to /app
 WORKDIR /app
 
-# Install the application as a package
-RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache
-
 # Health check with comprehensive validation
 HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
     CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix: resolve Docker permission issues and volume mounting

- Fix Docker user ID mismatch (1001->1000) for proper file permissions
- Enable Claude CLI directory mounting in docker-compose.yml  
- Add README.md copy to Dockerfile for Poetry package installation
- Remove problematic Poetry package installation step

These changes fix Claude CLI permission denied errors and enable 
proper volume mounting for authentication files.

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

services:
  claude_bot:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      # - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude  # Disable for debugging
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    # user: "1001:1001"  # Disable user override for debugging
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

content.content:
1‚Üí# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
     2‚Üí# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
     3‚Üí# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíFROM python:3.11-slim
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí# Build arguments for flexibility
     8‚ÜíARG USER_UID=1001
     9‚ÜíARG USER_GID=1001
    10‚ÜíARG USERNAME=claudebot
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
    13‚ÜíRUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    14‚Üí    curl \
    15‚Üí    git \
    16‚Üí    jq \
    17‚Üí    gcc \
    18‚Üí    g++ \
    19‚Üí    ca-certificates \
    20‚Üí    gnupg \
    21‚Üí    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    22‚Üí    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    23‚Üí    && apt-get update \
    24‚Üí    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    25‚Üí    && apt-get clean \
    26‚Üí    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    27‚Üí    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
    30‚ÜíRUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    31‚Üí    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
    34‚ÜíRUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    35‚Üí    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí# Set environment variables
    38‚ÜíENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
    39‚ÜíENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"

file.content:
# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Install the application as a package
RUN cd /home/${USERNAME} && poetry install --only-root --no-cache

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="0.1.1" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "src.main"]

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1001
ARG USER_GID=1001
ARG USERNAME=claudebot
edits.new_string:
# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1000
ARG USER_GID=1000
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock ./

\n\

input.content:
# Claude Code Telegram Bot - Deployment Guide

## Quick Deployment (Standalone)

For easy deployment on any server without volume mounting complexity:

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)

1. **Clone the repository:**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot.git
cd claude-notifer-and-bot
```

2. **Create environment file:**
```bash
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your settings
```

3. **Required environment variables:**
```bash
# Required
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token_here
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project

# Authentication (choose one or both)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # Telegram user IDs
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secret_here

# Claude Authentication (for standalone mode)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_anthropic_api_key  # Optional but recommended
```

4. **Deploy:**
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### Using Docker Hub Image (Simplest)

```bash
# Pull the standalone image
docker pull kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone

# Run with minimal configuration
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username \
  -e ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
```

## Authentication Options

### 1. Standalone Mode (Default)
- No volume mounting required
- Uses `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable
- Container handles Claude CLI authentication internally
- Perfect for clean deployments

### 2. Host Authentication Mount (Advanced)
If you already have Claude CLI configured on host:
```yaml
# Uncomment in docker-compose.yml
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
```

## Version Comparison

| Version | Description | Volume Mount | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| `latest` | Current with host auth | Required | Local development |
| `1.0.4-standalone` | Self-contained | Optional | Production deployment |
| `1.0.3` | Legacy with mounting | Required | Existing setups |

## Troubleshooting

### Permission Issues
If you encounter permission errors:
1. Use standalone mode (no volume mounting)
2. Ensure `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set
3. Check Docker user mapping

### Authentication Problems
1. Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is valid
2. Check bot token and username
3. Ensure user IDs are correct in `ALLOWED_USERS`

## Migration Guide

### From v1.0.3 to v1.0.4-standalone
1. Add `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` to your `.env`
2. Comment out `~/.claude` volume mount
3. Update image tag to `1.0.4-standalone`
4. Restart container

```bash
# Update docker-compose.yml image tag
image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone

# Restart
docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d
```

1‚Üí# Claude Telegram Bot - Deployment Guide
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Quick Deployment on New Server
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíThis guide will help you deploy the working Claude Telegram Bot on a new server.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Prerequisites
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí- Docker and Docker Compose installed
    10‚Üí- Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather
    11‚Üí- Your Telegram User ID (get from @userinfobot)
    12‚Üí- **–í–ê–ñ–õ–ò–í–û**: –ê–≤—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π Claude CLI (–ø–∞–ø–∫–∞ ~/.claude –∑ –≤–∞—à–æ—ó —Ä–æ–±–æ—á–æ—ó –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∏)
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí## Step 1: Prepare Claude CLI Authentication
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí**On your current working machine** (where Claude CLI is authenticated):
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí```bash
    19‚Üí# Copy your authenticated Claude config
    20‚Üítar -czf claude-config.tar.gz ~/.claude
    21‚Üí```
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíTransfer this file to your new server.
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí## Step 2: Server Setup
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí**On your new server:**
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí1. **Install Docker and Docker Compose:**
    30‚Üí```bash
    31‚Üí# Update system
    32‚Üísudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí# Install Docker
    35‚Üícurl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
    36‚Üísudo sh get-docker.sh
    37‚Üísudo usermod -aG docker $USER
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí# Install Docker Compose
    40‚Üísudo apt install docker-compose-plugin
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí# Logout and login again for group changes to take effect
    43‚Üí```
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí2. **Create project directory:**
    46‚Üí```bash
    47‚Üímkdir claude-telegram-bot
    48‚Üícd claude-telegram-bot
    49‚Üí```
    50‚Üí
    51‚Üí3. **Download deployment files:**
    52‚Üí```bash
    53‚Üí# Download the deployment configuration
    54‚Üícurl -o docker-compose.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot/main/docker-compose.deploy.yml
    55‚Üícurl -o .env.template https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot/main/.env.template
    56‚Üí```
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí## Step 3: Configure Environment
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí1. **Create environment file:**
    61‚Üí```bash
    62‚Üícp .env.template .env
    63‚Üínano .env
    64‚Üí```
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí2. **Fill in required values in .env:**
    67‚Üí```bash
    68‚Üí# REQUIRED - Get from @BotFather
    69‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=1234567890:ABCdefGHIjklMNOpqrsTUVwxyz
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí# REQUIRED - Your bot username (without @)
    72‚ÜíTELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=YourBotName_bot
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí# REQUIRED - Your Telegram user ID (get from @userinfobot)
    75‚ÜíALLOWED_USERS=123456789
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí# OPTIONAL - Chat ID for notifications
    78‚ÜíCLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=123456789
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí# NOTE: No Claude API tokens needed! Bot uses your mounted ~/.claude directory
    81‚Üí```
    82‚Üí
    83‚Üí## Step 4: Set Up Claude Authentication
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí1. **Extract Claude config:**
    86‚Üí```bash
    87‚Üí# Extract the claude-config.tar.gz you transferred from working machine
    88‚Üítar -xzf claude-config.tar.gz
    89‚Üímv .claude claude-config
    90‚Üí```
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí2. **Create required directories:**
    93‚Üí```bash
    94‚Üímkdir -p data target_project
    95‚Üí```
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí## Step 5: Deploy
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí1. **Start the bot:**
   100‚Üí```bash
   101‚Üídocker-compose up -d
   102‚Üí```
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí2. **Check logs:**
   105‚Üí```bash
   106‚Üídocker-compose logs -f claude_bot
   107‚Üí```
   108‚Üí
   109‚Üí3. **Test the bot:**
   110‚ÜíSend a message to your Telegram bot to verify it's working.
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí## Directory Structure
   113‚Üí
   114‚ÜíAfter setup, your directory should look like:
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí```
   117‚Üíclaude-telegram-bot/
   118‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-compose.yml
   119‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env
   120‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-config/           # Claude CLI authentication
   121‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .credentials.json
   122‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
   123‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                    # Bot data persistence
   124‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ target_project/         # Your project files
   125‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-config.tar.gz    # Original backup
   126‚Üí```
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí## Managing the Bot
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí### Start/Stop
   131‚Üí```bash
   132‚Üí# Start
   133‚Üídocker-compose up -d
   134‚Üí
   135‚Üí# Stop
   136‚Üídocker-compose down
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí# Restart
   139‚Üídocker-compose restart
   140‚Üí```
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí### View Logs
   143‚Üí```bash
   144‚Üí# Follow logs
   145‚Üídocker-compose logs -f claude_bot
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí# View recent logs

# Claude Telegram Bot - Deployment Guide

## Quick Deployment on New Server

This guide will help you deploy the working Claude Telegram Bot on a new server.

## Prerequisites

- Docker and Docker Compose installed
- Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather
- Your Telegram User ID (get from @userinfobot)
- **–í–ê–ñ–õ–ò–í–û**: –ê–≤—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π Claude CLI (–ø–∞–ø–∫–∞ ~/.claude –∑ –≤–∞—à–æ—ó —Ä–æ–±–æ—á–æ—ó –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∏)

## Step 1: Prepare Claude CLI Authentication

**On your current working machine** (where Claude CLI is authenticated):

```bash
# Copy your authenticated Claude config
tar -czf claude-config.tar.gz ~/.claude
```

Transfer this file to your new server.

## Step 2: Server Setup

**On your new server:**

1. **Install Docker and Docker Compose:**
```bash
# Update system
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

# Install Docker
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Install Docker Compose
sudo apt install docker-compose-plugin

# Logout and login again for group changes to take effect
```

2. **Create project directory:**
```bash
mkdir claude-telegram-bot
cd claude-telegram-bot
```

3. **Download deployment files:**
```bash
# Download the deployment configuration
curl -o docker-compose.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot/main/docker-compose.deploy.yml
curl -o .env.template https://raw.githubusercontent.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot/main/.env.template
```

## Step 3: Configure Environment

1. **Create environment file:**
```bash
cp .env.template .env
nano .env
```

2. **Fill in required values in .env:**
```bash
# REQUIRED - Get from @BotFather
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=1234567890:ABCdefGHIjklMNOpqrsTUVwxyz

# REQUIRED - Your bot username (without @)
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=YourBotName_bot

# REQUIRED - Your Telegram user ID (get from @userinfobot)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789

# OPTIONAL - Chat ID for notifications
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=123456789

# NOTE: No Claude API tokens needed! Bot uses your mounted ~/.claude directory
```

## Step 4: Set Up Claude Authentication

1. **Extract Claude config:**
```bash
# Extract the claude-config.tar.gz you transferred from working machine
tar -xzf claude-config.tar.gz
mv .claude claude-config
```

2. **Create required directories:**
```bash
mkdir -p data target_project
```

## Step 5: Deploy

1. **Start the bot:**
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

2. **Check logs:**
```bash
docker-compose logs -f claude_bot
```

3. **Test the bot:**
Send a message to your Telegram bot to verify it's working.

## Directory Structure

After setup, your directory should look like:

```
claude-telegram-bot/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-compose.yml
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-config/           # Claude CLI authentication
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .credentials.json
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                    # Bot data persistence
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ target_project/         # Your project files
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ claude-config.tar.gz    # Original backup
```

## Managing the Bot

### Start/Stop
```bash
# Start
docker-compose up -d

# Stop
docker-compose down

# Restart
docker-compose restart
```

### View Logs
```bash
# Follow logs
docker-compose logs -f claude_bot

# View recent logs
docker-compose logs --tail=100 claude_bot
```

### Update Bot
```bash
# Pull latest image
docker-compose pull

# Restart with new image
docker-compose up -d
```

## Troubleshooting

### Bot shows "Claude Code exited with code 1"

1. Check Claude authentication:
```bash
docker exec claude-code-bot-prod claude auth status
```

2. If authentication failed, fix permissions:
```bash
docker exec -u root claude-code-bot-prod chown claudebot:claudebot /home/claudebot/.claude/.credentials.json
docker-compose restart
```

### Bot not responding to messages

1. Check bot is running:
```bash
docker-compose ps
```

2. Check logs for errors:
```bash
docker-compose logs claude_bot
```

3. Verify your user ID is in ALLOWED_USERS

### Performance Issues

1. Check resource usage:
```bash
docker stats claude-code-bot-prod
```

2. Adjust resource limits in docker-compose.yml if needed

## Security Notes

- Keep your `.env` file secure and never commit it to version control
- The `claude-config` directory contains sensitive authentication data
- Consider setting up firewall rules if the server is public-facing
- Regularly update the Docker image for security patches

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check the troubleshooting section above
2. Review logs for specific error messages
3. Ensure all environment variables are correctly set
4. Verify Claude CLI authentication is working

## Image Versions

- **Production**: `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:v0.1.2-working`
- **Latest**: `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest`

The `v0.1.2-working` tag contains the tested and verified working version.

input.content:
# Claude Code Telegram Bot - Deployment Guide

## Quick Deployment (Standalone Mode)

**NEW**: For easy deployment on any server without volume mounting complexity.

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)

1. **Clone the repository:**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot.git
cd claude-notifer-and-bot
```

2. **Create environment file:**
```bash
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your settings
```

3. **Required environment variables:**
```bash
# Required
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token_here
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project

# Authentication (choose one or both)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # Telegram user IDs
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secret_here

# Claude Authentication (for standalone mode)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_anthropic_api_key  # Recommended for standalone deployment
```

4. **Deploy:**
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### Using Docker Hub Image (Simplest)

```bash
# Pull the standalone image
docker pull kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone

# Run with minimal configuration
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username \
  -e ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
```

## Authentication Options

### 1. Standalone Mode (Default - Recommended)
- ‚úÖ No volume mounting required
- ‚úÖ Uses `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable
- ‚úÖ Container handles Claude CLI authentication internally
- ‚úÖ Perfect for clean deployments on new servers
- ‚úÖ No permission issues

### 2. Host Authentication Mount (Advanced)
If you already have Claude CLI configured on host:
```yaml
# Uncomment in docker-compose.yml
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
```

## Version Comparison

| Version | Description | Volume Mount | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| `1.0.4-standalone` | **Self-contained** | Optional | **‚úÖ Production deployment** |
| `latest` | Current with host auth | Required | Local development |
| `1.0.3` | Legacy with mounting | Required | Existing setups |

## Quick Start for New Server

**Minimal setup for new server deployment:**

1. **Install Docker:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
# Logout and login again
```

2. **Create deployment directory:**
```bash
mkdir claude-bot && cd claude-bot
```

3. **Create docker-compose.yml:**
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username  
      - ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key
      - ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id
      - APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
```

4. **Start:**
```bash
mkdir -p data target_project
docker-compose up -d
```

## Troubleshooting

### Permission Issues
- ‚úÖ Use standalone mode (no volume mounting)
- ‚úÖ Ensure `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set
- ‚ùå No Docker user mapping issues

### Authentication Problems
1. Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is valid
2. Check bot token and username
3. Ensure user IDs are correct in `ALLOWED_USERS`

### Migration from Previous Versions
```bash
# Update image to standalone
docker-compose down
# Edit docker-compose.yml: image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
# Add ANTHROPIC_API_KEY to environment
# Comment out ~/.claude volume mount
docker-compose up -d
```

## Legacy Deployment (with Host Authentication)

<details>
<summary>Click to expand legacy deployment method</summary>

### Prerequisites (Legacy)
- Docker and Docker Compose installed
- Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather  
- Your Telegram User ID (get from @userinfobot)
- **–í–ê–ñ–õ–ò–í–û**: –ê–≤—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π Claude CLI (–ø–∞–ø–∫–∞ ~/.claude –∑ –≤–∞—à–æ—ó —Ä–æ–±–æ—á–æ—ó –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∏)

### Step 1: Prepare Claude CLI Authentication
**On your current working machine** (where Claude CLI is authenticated):
```bash
tar -czf claude-config.tar.gz ~/.claude
```

### Step 2-5: [Previous deployment steps remain the same]
</details>

## Support

- **Recommended**: Use `1.0.4-standalone` for new deployments
- For issues: Check logs with `docker-compose logs claude_bot`
- Authentication: Standalone mode handles it automatically with `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`

**NEW**: For easy deployment on any server without volume mounting complexity.

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)

1. **Clone the repository:**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot.git
cd claude-notifer-and-bot
```

2. **Create environment file:**

```bash
cp .env.example .env
```

```bash
# Required

ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secret_here

# Claude Authentication (for standalone mode)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_anthropic_api_key  # Recommended for standalone deployment
```

4. **Deploy:**
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### Using Docker Hub Image (Simplest)

```bash
# Pull the standalone image
docker pull kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone

# Run with minimal configuration
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username \
  -e ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
```

## Authentication Options

### 1. Standalone Mode (Default - Recommended)
- ‚úÖ No volume mounting required
- ‚úÖ Uses `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable
- ‚úÖ Container handles Claude CLI authentication internally
- ‚úÖ Perfect for clean deployments on new servers
- ‚úÖ No permission issues

### 2. Host Authentication Mount (Advanced)
If you already have Claude CLI configured on host:
```yaml
# Uncomment in docker-compose.yml
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
```

## Version Comparison

| Version | Description | Volume Mount | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| `1.0.4-standalone` | **Self-contained** | Optional | **‚úÖ Production deployment** |
| `latest` | Current with host auth | Required | Local development |
| `1.0.3` | Legacy with mounting | Required | Existing setups |

## Quick Start for New Server

**Minimal setup for new server deployment:**

1. **Install Docker:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
# Logout and login again
```

2. **Create deployment directory:**
```bash
mkdir claude-bot && cd claude-bot
```

3. **Create docker-compose.yml:**
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username  
      - ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key
      - ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id
      - APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
```

4. **Start:**
```bash
mkdir -p data target_project
docker-compose up -d
```

## Troubleshooting

### Permission Issues
- ‚úÖ Use standalone mode (no volume mounting)
- ‚úÖ Ensure `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set
- ‚ùå No Docker user mapping issues

### Authentication Problems
1. Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is valid
2. Check bot token and username
3. Ensure user IDs are correct in `ALLOWED_USERS`

### Migration from Previous Versions
```bash
# Update image to standalone
docker-compose down
# Edit docker-compose.yml: image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
# Add ANTHROPIC_API_KEY to environment
# Comment out ~/.claude volume mount
docker-compose up -d
```

## Legacy Deployment (with Host Authentication)

- Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: add standalone Docker deployment mode

- Create standalone mode that doesn't require volume mounting
- Add internal Claude CLI authentication via ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
- Update docker-compose.yml to make ~/.claude mounting optional
- Create startup script for automatic Claude CLI setup
- Add comprehensive DEPLOYMENT.md with standalone instructions
- Version bump to 1.0.4-standalone for easy identification

Benefits:
- ‚úÖ No volume mounting complexity
- ‚úÖ No permission issues
- ‚úÖ Perfect for clean deployments on new servers
- ‚úÖ Uses environment variables for authentication

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

### –ö–ª—é—á–æ–≤—ñ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–∞–≥–∏ standalone —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º—É:

**‚úÖ –ë–µ–∑ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º –∑ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞–º–∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø—É**
- –ù–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –º–æ–Ω—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ `~/.claude` –∑ —Ö–æ—Å—Ç–∞
- –ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä —Å–∞–º –∫–µ—Ä—É—î –∞—É—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é
- –ñ–æ–¥–Ω–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º –∑ UID/GID mapping

**‚úÖ –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ—Ç–∞ —Ä–æ–∑–≥–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è**
- –ü–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` –≤ environment
- –û–¥–∏–Ω Docker Hub pull —ñ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ
- –Ü–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ö —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä—ñ–≤

**‚úÖ –ú—ñ–Ω—ñ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è**
```bash
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_token \

  -e ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_key \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_user_id \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
```

### –î–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ñ –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—ó:
- `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone` - –ù–æ–≤–∞ standalone –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—è

toolUseResult.originalFile:
services:
  claude_bot:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Optional: Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # Uncomment if you want to use existing host Claude CLI authentication
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      # - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    user: "1000:1000"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

RUN echo '#!/bin/bash
\
# Claude CLI Authentication Setup
\
if [ ! -z "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && [ ! -f ~/.claude/.credentials.json ]; then
\
  echo "Setting up Claude CLI with provided API key..."
\
  mkdir -p ~/.claude
\
  echo "{"sessionKey":"$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY"}" > ~/.claude/.credentials.json
\
fi
\

\
# Start the application
\
exec python -m src.main "$@"
' > /home/${USERNAME}/entrypoint.sh \

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Production-ready Dockerfile for Claude Telegram Bot
# Built for remote server deployment with user: kroschu
# Image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:latest

FROM python:3.11-slim

# Build arguments for flexibility
ARG USER_UID=1000
ARG USER_GID=1000
ARG USERNAME=claudebot

# Install system dependencies including Node.js for Claude CLI
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    curl \
    git \
    jq \
    gcc \
    g++ \
    ca-certificates \
    gnupg \
    && curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg \
    && echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list \
    && apt-get update \
    && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends nodejs \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && rm -rf /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

# Create non-root user with consistent UID/GID for volume mounting
RUN groupadd -g ${USER_GID} ${USERNAME} \
    && useradd -m -u ${USER_UID} -g ${USER_GID} -s /bin/bash ${USERNAME}

# Create application and data directories with proper ownership
RUN mkdir -p /app/data /app/target_project \
    && chown -R ${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} /app

# Set environment variables
ENV HOME=/home/${USERNAME}
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:$PATH"
ENV PYTHONPATH=/app
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV TZ=Europe/Kiev

# Switch to non-root user
USER ${USERNAME}
WORKDIR /home/${USERNAME}

# Install Poetry
RUN curl -sSL https://install.python-poetry.org | python3 -
ENV PATH="/home/${USERNAME}/.local/bin:${PATH}"

# Copy dependency files for Poetry
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} pyproject.toml poetry.lock README.md ./

# Configure Poetry and install Python dependencies
RUN poetry config virtualenvs.create false \
    && poetry config virtualenvs.in-project false \
    && poetry install --only=main --no-root --no-cache

# Install Claude CLI and create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p ~/.local/bin ~/.claude/plugins/repos \
    && npm install @anthropic-ai/claude-code \
    && ln -s "$(pwd)/node_modules/.bin/claude" ~/.local/bin/claude

# Copy application code to /app
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} src/ /app/src/
COPY --chown=${USERNAME}:${USERNAME} CLAUDE.md /app/

# Set working directory to /app
WORKDIR /app

# Create startup script for Claude CLI authentication
RUN echo '#!/bin/bash\n\
# Claude CLI Authentication Setup\n\
if [ ! -z "$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" ] && [ ! -f ~/.claude/.credentials.json ]; then\n\
  echo "Setting up Claude CLI with provided API key..."\n\
  mkdir -p ~/.claude\n\
  echo "{\"sessionKey\":\"$ANTHROPIC_API_KEY\"}" > ~/.claude/.credentials.json\n\
fi\n\
\n\
# Start the application\n\
exec python -m src.main "$@"\n' > /home/${USERNAME}/entrypoint.sh \
    && chmod +x /home/${USERNAME}/entrypoint.sh

# Health check with comprehensive validation
HEALTHCHECK --interval=60s --timeout=15s --start-period=45s --retries=3 \
    CMD python -c "try: import src.main; from src.config.settings import Settings; Settings(); print('‚úì Health check passed'); exit(0)\nexcept Exception as e: print(f'‚úó Health check failed: {e}'); exit(1)"

# Labels for container management
LABEL maintainer="kroschu" \
      version="1.0.4-standalone" \
      description="Claude Code Telegram Bot - Remote access to Claude CLI via Telegram" \
      org.label-schema.vcs-url="https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot"

# Default command with authentication setup
ENTRYPOINT ["/home/claudebot/entrypoint.sh"]

services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Optional: Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # Uncomment if you want to use existing host Claude CLI authentication
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      # - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    user: "1000:1000"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

input.command: timeout 30 docker exec claude-code-bot claude auth status

content.content:
The authentication system in this Claude Code Telegram Bot supports two main authentication methods:

## Current Authentication Methods

**1. Whitelist Authentication** (`WhitelistAuthProvider`)
- Uses Telegram user IDs in an allowlist
- Configured via `ALLOWED_USERS` environment variable
- Supports development mode with `allow_all_dev` flag

**2. Token Authentication** (`TokenAuthProvider`) 
- JWT-like token system with configurable lifetime (default 30 days)
- Tokens are hashed with SHA-256 and stored securely
- Supports token generation, verification, and revocation
- Configured via `ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH` and `AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET`

## Key Features

- **Multiple Provider Support**: Can use both methods simultaneously
- **Session Management**: 24-hour session timeout with activity refresh
- **Security**: Token hashing, audit logging, automatic session cleanup
- **Storage**: In-memory token storage (extendable to database)

The authentication is configured in your `.env` file and managed by the `AuthenticationManager` class which handles provider orchestration and session lifecycle.

What specific aspect of the authentication system would you like to work with?

content.content:
This Claude Code Telegram Bot has a comprehensive authentication system with multiple authentication methods:

## Authentication Providers

**Two authentication methods are supported:**

1. **Whitelist Authentication** (`WhitelistAuthProvider`):
   - Uses Telegram user IDs in an allowed list
   - Configured via `ALLOWED_USERS` environment variable
   - Supports `allow_all_dev` mode for development

2. **Token-Based Authentication** (`TokenAuthProvider`):
   - Uses secure tokens with SHA-256 hashing
   - 30-day token lifetime by default
   - Supports token generation, verification, and revocation

## Session Management

**Sessions include:**
- 24-hour default timeout
- Automatic expiration cleanup  
- Activity tracking and refresh
- User info storage
- Provider identification

## Authentication Manager

**Centralized management via `AuthenticationManager`:**
- Supports multiple providers simultaneously
- Automatic session creation and cleanup
- Comprehensive logging and audit trails
- Credential validation across all providers

## Configuration

**Environment variables:**
- `ALLOWED_USERS`: Comma-separated Telegram user IDs
- `ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH`: Enable token authentication
- `AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET`: Secret for token hashing

The system uses a layered security approach with proper credential hashing, session timeouts, and comprehensive audit logging.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Claude Code Telegram Bot - Deployment Guide

## Quick Deployment (Standalone Mode)

**NEW**: For easy deployment on any server without volume mounting complexity.

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)

1. **Clone the repository:**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/maxfraieho/claude-notifer-and-bot.git
cd claude-notifer-and-bot
```

2. **Create environment file:**
```bash
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your settings
```

3. **Required environment variables:**
```bash
# Required
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token_here
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project

# Authentication (choose one or both)
ALLOWED_USERS=123456789,987654321  # Telegram user IDs
ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=your_secret_here

# Claude Authentication (for standalone mode)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_anthropic_api_key  # Recommended for standalone deployment
```

4. **Deploy:**
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### Using Docker Hub Image (Simplest)

```bash
# Pull the standalone image
docker pull kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone

# Run with minimal configuration
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username \
  -e ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
```

## Authentication Options

### 1. Standalone Mode (Default - Recommended)
- ‚úÖ No volume mounting required
- ‚úÖ Uses `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` environment variable
- ‚úÖ Container handles Claude CLI authentication internally
- ‚úÖ Perfect for clean deployments on new servers
- ‚úÖ No permission issues

### 2. Host Authentication Mount (Advanced)
If you already have Claude CLI configured on host:
```yaml
# Uncomment in docker-compose.yml
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude
```

## Version Comparison

| Version | Description | Volume Mount | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|--------------|----------|
| `1.0.4-standalone` | **Self-contained** | Optional | **‚úÖ Production deployment** |
| `latest` | Current with host auth | Required | Local development |
| `1.0.3` | Legacy with mounting | Required | Existing setups |

## Quick Start for New Server

**Minimal setup for new server deployment:**

1. **Install Docker:**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh
sudo sh get-docker.sh
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
# Logout and login again
```

2. **Create deployment directory:**
```bash
mkdir claude-bot && cd claude-bot
```

3. **Create docker-compose.yml:**
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_bot_token
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot_username  
      - ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your_api_key
      - ALLOWED_USERS=your_telegram_user_id
      - APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
```

4. **Start:**
```bash
mkdir -p data target_project
docker-compose up -d
```

## Troubleshooting

### Permission Issues
- ‚úÖ Use standalone mode (no volume mounting)
- ‚úÖ Ensure `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is set
- ‚ùå No Docker user mapping issues

### Authentication Problems
1. Verify `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` is valid
2. Check bot token and username
3. Ensure user IDs are correct in `ALLOWED_USERS`

### Migration from Previous Versions
```bash
# Update image to standalone
docker-compose down
# Edit docker-compose.yml: image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
# Add ANTHROPIC_API_KEY to environment
# Comment out ~/.claude volume mount
docker-compose up -d
```

## Legacy Deployment (with Host Authentication)

- Telegram Bot Token from @BotFather  
- Your Telegram User ID (get from @userinfobot)

### Step 1: Prepare Claude CLI Authentication

input.command:
git add -A && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix: correct standalone mode to use Claude CLI subprocess mode

- Fix USE_SDK=false for proper Claude CLI subprocess execution
- Remove ANTHROPIC_API_KEY dependency (not needed for CLI mode)
- Update startup script to only create directory structure
- Update documentation for container-based authentication
- Version 1.0.4-standalone-fixed with proper Claude CLI integration

Key changes:
- USE_SDK=false enforces Claude CLI subprocess mode
- Entrypoint creates ~/.claude structure without credentials
- Users setup Claude CLI auth inside container after deployment
- No API keys in environment variables needed

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)" && git push

content.text:
## ‚úÖ –í–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—É standalone –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—é —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ!

**–†–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç:**

### ‚úÖ –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è:
- **`USE_SDK=false`** - –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—î Claude CLI subprocess mode
- **–ñ–æ–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ ANTHROPIC_API_KEY** - –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω –¥–ª—è CLI —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º—É
- **–ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏–π entrypoint** - —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é—î —Ç—ñ–ª—å–∫–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä—ñ–π
- **–°–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∂–Ω—è Claude CLI –∞—É—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—è** - —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ `claude auth login`

### üê≥ Docker Hub –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—ó:
- `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed` - **–í–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—è**
- `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone` - –°—Ç–∞—Ä–∞ –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—è –∑ ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
- `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:standalone` - Alias

### üìã –Ø–∫ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –≤–∏–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—É standalone –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—é:

1. **–ó–∞–ø—É—Å–∫ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∞:**
```bash
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=your_token \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=your_bot \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=your_user_id \
  -e USE_SDK=false \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed
```

2. **–ù–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è Claude CLI –≤—Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—ñ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä–∞:**
```bash
docker exec -it claude-code-bot bash
claude auth login  # –í–∏–∫–æ–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –∞—É—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ—ñ–∫–∞—Ü—ñ—é
```

3. **–ê–±–æ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∑ volume mount:**
```yaml
volumes:
  - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude  # Mount existing auth
```

**–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä standalone –≤–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—è –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—î –∫–æ—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω–æ –∑ Claude CLI subprocess —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º–æ–º!** üéØ

–¢–∞–∫! –í–µ—Ä—Å—ñ—è `kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed` –≤–∂–µ –Ω–∞ Docker Hub.

–ë–∞—á–∏–º–æ –≤ –ª–æ–≥–∞—Ö push –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∏:

services:
  claude_bot:
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone
    container_name: claude-code-bot
    restart: unless-stopped
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - ./data:/app/data
      # Optional: Mount the Claude CLI authentication directory from the host
      # Uncomment if you want to use existing host Claude CLI authentication
      # For Linux/macOS: ~/.claude
      # For Windows: ${USERPROFILE}/.claude
      # - ~/.claude:/home/claudebot/.claude  # Standalone mode - no mounting needed
      - ./target_project:/app/target_project  # ‚úÖ New volume for target project
    working_dir: /app
    user: "1000:1000"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
      interval: 60s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    logging:
      driver: "json-file"
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"

volumes:
  data:

# Telegram bot token from BotFather
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs

# Bot username
TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=DevClaude_bot

# Authentication settings - explicitly set to empty to avoid parsing conflicts
ALLOWED_USERS=6412868393

# Token-based authentication (disabled for development)
# ENABLE_TOKEN_AUTH=true
# AUTH_TOKEN_SECRET=claude_bot_secret_key_123

# Required directory path
APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project

# Claude availability monitoring
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1003070030465
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=60
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_START=23:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_END=08:00
CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DEBOUNCE_OK_COUNT=2

# Target project path
TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project

# Debug settings
DEBUG=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false

# Database settings - use temp directory for now
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////tmp/bot.db
USE_SDK=false
# ANTHROPIC_API_KEY not needed for CLI subprocess mode

## üöÄ –ö–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∏ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫—É –∑ –ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–º–∏ –Ω–∞–ª–∞—à—Ç—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è–º–∏:

### **1. Docker Run (–º—ñ–Ω—ñ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞)**
```bash
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=DevClaude_bot \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=6412868393 \
  -e APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project \
  -e USE_SDK=false \
  -v ./data:/app/data \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed
```

### **2. Docker Run (–ø–æ–≤–Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—è)**
```bash
docker run -d \
  --name claude-code-bot \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs \
  -e TELEGRAM_BOT_USERNAME=DevClaude_bot \
  -e ALLOWED_USERS=6412868393 \
  -e APPROVED_DIRECTORY=/app/target_project \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_MONITOR=true \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_NOTIFY_CHAT_IDS=-1003070030465 \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_CHECK_INTERVAL=60 \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_START=23:00 \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DND_END=08:00 \
  -e CLAUDE_AVAILABILITY_DEBOUNCE_OK_COUNT=2 \
  -e TARGET_PROJECT_PATH=/app/target_project \
  -e DEBUG=false \
  -e LOG_LEVEL=INFO \
  -e DEVELOPMENT_MODE=false \
  -e DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////tmp/bot.db \
  -e USE_SDK=false \
  -v ./data:/app/data \
  -v ./target_project:/app/target_project \
  --health-cmd="python -c \"import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)\"" \
  --health-interval=60s \
  --health-timeout=10s \
  --health-retries=3 \
  kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed
```

### **3. Docker Compose (—Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ)**

```yaml
    image: kroschu/claude-code-telegram:1.0.4-standalone-fixed

    environment:
      - TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN=8413521828:AAF7hnLvGXGAacrWgo6teNvtsNU-WzCY6Hs

      test: ["CMD", "python", "-c", "import sys; sys.exit(0) if __import__('src.main') else sys.exit(1)"]
```

**–ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–π–Ω–µ—Ä –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∏–π –¥–æ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏ –∑ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ—é –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü—ñ—î—é!** üéØ
